greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest 4th-power divisible by n divided by largest 4th-power which divides n.
link: Amiram Eldar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(64)=16 because smallest 4th power divisible by 64 is 256 and largest 4th power which divides 64 is 16 and 256/16=16.
mathematica: f[p_, e_] := p^If[Divisible[e, 4], 0, 1]; a[n_] := (Times @@ (f @@@ FactorInteger[ n]))^4; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Aug 29 2019*)
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 25 2000
